AFTCoop 0.1.1
  • Reference

    Proximal Gradient Descent for Cooperative AFT Model Estimation

    proxGD.coop.Rd

    proxGD.coop implements proximal gradient descent optimization for cooperative estimation in Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) models. The function minimizes an objective function that combines negative log-likelihood, L1 regularization, and a cooperative term.

    proxGD.coop(
  X,
  Y,
  delta,
  coop,
  beta0,
  sigma = NULL,
  rho = NULL,
  lambda = NULL,
  model,
  niter = 1000
)

    Arguments

    X

    Matrix of standardized covariates

    Y

    Vector of log observed survival times or log censored times (response variable in log scale)

    delta

    Vector of censoring indicators (1 for event, 0 for censored)

    coop

    Cooperative matrix (typically t(Xtilde) %*% Xtilde)

    beta0

    Initial vector of coefficients

    sigma

    Scale parameter for the AFT model

    rho

    Cooperation parameter controlling L1 vs cooperative trade-off (

    lambda

    Regularization parameter

    model

    Character string specifying the AFT model type

    niter

    Maximum number of iterations (default: 1000)

    Value

    A list containing:

    • beta: Vector of optimized coefficients

    • objective: Final value of the objective function

    Details

    The function minimizes the objective: $$f(\beta) = -\log L(\beta) + \lambda\rho\|\beta\|_1 + \lambda(1-\rho)\beta^T C\beta$$ where:

    • \(-\log L(\beta)\) is the negative log-likelihood

    • \(\|\beta\|_1\) is the L1 norm (lasso penalty)

    • \(\beta^T C\beta\) is the cooperative term

    The algorithm uses:

    • Adaptive line search with backtracking

    • Lipschitz constant adaptation

    • Early stopping based on relative change in objective

    • Memory-efficient vector operations

    Convergence is determined by relative change in objective value falling below conv = 0.001.

    Note

    Last change 07/04/2025

    Implementation Notes

    • Uses pre-allocation for memory efficiency

    • Implements line search with sufficient decrease condition

    • Precomputes lambda terms to avoid repeated multiplication

    • Uses vectorized operations where possible

    See also

    prox.l1 for the proximal operator of L1 norm nll for negative log-likelihood computation gradient for gradient computation hessian_coop for Hessian and Lipschitz constant computation

    Contents
